ticket.title: Null values cannot be specified in CSV fixtures.
ticket.original-body:
Exact problem as reported in Rails Trac #7500: http://dev.rubyonrails.org/ticket/7500
The patch there fixes the problem for us, but it would certainly be nice if we didn't have to monkey patch ActiveRecord.
ticket.latest-body:

The patch there fixes the problem for us, but it would certainly be nice if we didn't have to monkey patch ActiveRecord.

version.title: Null values cannot be specified in CSV fixtures.

version.body:
The patch from the original ticket doesn't apply cleanly anymore, but with some tweaking I could confirm this is still broken on edge.
Any chance you could come up with a diff with a test case?
version.body-html:
The patch from the original ticket doesn't apply cleanly anymore, but with some tweaking I could confirm this is still broken on edge.

Any chance you could come up with a diff with a test case?
version.title: Null values cannot be specified in CSV fixtures.

version.body: The patch from the original ticket doesn't apply cleanly anymore, but with some ivory wedding dress series I could confirm this is still broken on edge.Any chance you could come up with a diff with a test case?
version.body-html: The patch from the original ticket doesn't apply cleanly anymore, but with some ivory wedding dress series I could confirm this is still broken on edge.Any chance you could come up with a diff with a test case?
version.title: Null values cannot be specified in CSV fixtures.

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.body-html:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
